intro: Muratina zolotarevakyana, commonly known as the Zolotarevsky's muratina, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes plants known for their milky sap and often showy flowers. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale yellow or greenish in color, adapted for pollination by specific insect species. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
